ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is mandatory, so any recommendation is moot.
I would recommend the course for students who are interested in the workings of Art History, theoretical questions and the tricky points of method. Not recommended for positivist contextualists.
Required for first years! Great exposure to important methods in our field

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I was able to draw comparative connections between different methodological approaches.Widened the theoretical foundation of m own research methods.
This course was extremely useful for me because I did not have an undergraduate art historical methods class

As I said before, I feel that this class has helped me grow the most as a student this semester. I was exposed to art historians' thoughts and approaches to art that I had not encountered before. Moreover, I was consistently asked to compare methodologies, weighing their validity and use value against each other. Learning this type of scrutiny has been invaluable to the way I know understand the history and development of the history of art as we know it.
